sentences.sContent: ...We need very broad participation to fully address global tragedy that results when countries fail to take into account the negative impact of their carbon emissions on the rest of the world...
...Failure to address comprehensively the problem of greenhouse gas emissions...
...Yellen is likely to address the issue right after she pushes unemployment below 6%...
...I've been following some of the promising ideas emerging to address and prevent family homelessness...
...A number of readers asked whether the campaign will address family homelessness...
...and we do need to address it...
...To address the problem requires fresh thinking from governments about how people train for their working lives and what a living wage should be...
...has not helped to address fundamental weaknesses in business leadership...
...participants were less ready to support policies designed to address racial inequality than they had been two weeks before the election...
...Those trying to address issues of racial inequality need to constantly remind people of the inequalities that still exist to counteract the Obama's effect...
...Plenty of us create a “to-do” list to address feelings of being overwhelmed...

trans.tranOther: if you address a problem, you start trying to solve it
